column4: I've seen you can get games for "linux". what do they do about installing? have a deb and rpm option?
if you're talking about games like Quake or UT, they generally use a graphical installer similar to the windows version
how would it work what with "linux" meaning not much from an application level?
they're usually statically-linked binaries so they run on pretty much anything with the right hardware
i dont really know what that means but i'll take your word for it
nope, it's still a linux ELF binary. You might be able to run it on something like a BSD system which has an ELF loader
